Class RemoveTileCommand

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Commands.Command
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Commands.RemoveTileCommand
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class RemoveTileCommand extends Command implements Serializable
Represents a command to remove a tile from the player board. This command specifies the x and y coordinates of the tile to be removed and uses the specified game and player context to execute its operation. This class is a concrete implementation of the abstract Command class. It inputs specific tile coordinates (x, y) to identify the tile to be removed. Fields: - `x`: The x-coordinate of the tile to be removed. - `y`: The y-coordinate of the tile to be removed. - `commandType`: A string representing the type of the command, used for serialization purposes. Constructor: - Accepts coordinates (x, y), game information, and player context necessary to perform the operation. - Calls the parent `Command` constructor to initialize shared fields. Methods: - `allowedIn(PlayerState playerState)`: Checks whether the command is allowed in the provided player state. - `execute(Player player)`: Executes the removal of a tile on the player's board at the specified x-y coordinates.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • RemoveTileCommand

      public RemoveTileCommand()
      Represents a command to remove a tile in the game. The RemoveTileCommand class is a part of the game's command system, allowing the removal of a tile from a player's board at specific coordinates. This command includes logic to check if it is allowed in a player's current state and implements the actual removal action when executed.

    • RemoveTileCommand

      public RemoveTileCommand(int x, int y, String gameId, String playerId, int lv, String title, String token)
      Constructs a new RemoveTileCommand with the specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the tile to be removed
      y - the y-coordinate of the tile to be removed
      gameId - the unique identifier of the game
      playerId - the unique identifier of the player issuing the command
      lv - the level associated with the command
      title - the title or name of the command
      token - the token used for authentication or validation

    • allowedIn

      public boolean allowedIn(PlayerState playerState)
      Checks whether this command is allowed in the specified player state.
      Overrides:
      allowedIn in class Command
      Parameters:
      playerState - the current state of the player in which to check if the command is allowed
      Returns:
      true if the command is permitted in the provided player state, false otherwise

    • execute

      public void execute(Player player)
      Executes the command to remove a tile from the player's board at the specified x and y coordinates. This method interacts with the player's board to remove the designated tile.
      Specified by:
      execute in class Command
      Parameters:
      player - the player whose board the tile will be removed from
